text: Pataudi state was a small Princely state in India, established in 1804. It has an area of 52 square miles. In 1947 it became part of India.Om Gupta, Encyclopaedia of India, Pakistan and Bangladesh (Delhi : Isha Books, 2006), p. 1483 The capital Pataudi, is in present-day Haryana. == References == Category:Indian princely states Category:1804 establishments Category:19th- century establishments in India Category:1800s establishments in Asia Category:1947 disestablishments in India
title: Pataudi (princely state)
